Description: Worn painted pottery shabti of Djed-Khonsu(?), a Wʿb-priest of Amun(?) with a lappet-wig tied with a black fillet, a modelled face with black eyes and crossed arms in relief holding two black hoes; the front of the remaining leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs; the back is decorated with a representation of a black seed-basket; the lower leg section has broken away.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
